channel.title: Is this good for a first time model?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/1rbw3s.jpg[/img] [IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/von978.png[/img] please leave a comment :) thank you
Just an outline in the makin ;D
[IMG]http://i44.tinypic.com/15q2noo.jpg[/img]
[img width=500 height=177]http://i44.tinypic.com/8xq3qf.png[/img]

item.title: Is this good for a first time model?
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

You have to think to yourself when you make these, “Would this be effective in a sword fight?”, “Would this be functional to wield?” things like that. Tracing and extruding makes everything blocky, and would be very ineffective in a sword fight.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good for a first time model?

item.title: Is this good for a first time model?
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“krackkid, post:2, topic:426719”]Actually no it isn’t, Because you traced try using prims to make something. When I get up as a Christmas present to everyone I will make a video with voice of making a sword from 1 cube.
[hr]
But you’re trying and learning and I love you for that not many modelers around here. Check some tutorials in Amy_webbs sig or Reyx7.[/quote]
I’ve already made a video of that i believe, look up activitycrazy on youtube (poorly done when i was only 2 months into modelling or so but it works). I suggest looking at Reyx’s first and then taking a look at mine, Good luck.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good for a first time model?

item.title: Is this good for a first time model?
item.dc:creator: @callen callen
item.description:
@callen wrote:

[quote=“The Wanderer, post:5, topic:426719”]Use primitives and kiss. Keep it simple stupid. Model a weapon or something simple. Not a gun. :P[/quote]lol ok will do im learning prims as we speaking with a tut but im lost at parts

Read full topic

item.title: Is this good for a first time model?
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Use primitives and kiss. Keep it simple stupid. Model a weapon or something simple. Not a gun.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good for a first time model?

item.title: Is this good for a first time model?
item.dc:creator: @krackkid Krackkid
item.description:
@krackkid wrote:

[quote=“callen, post:3, topic:426719”][quote author=krackkid link=topic=529418.msg3863425#msg3863425 date=1324793619]
Actually no it isn’t, Because you traced try using prims to make something. When I get up as a Christmas present to everyone I will make a video with voice of making a sword from 1 cube.
[hr]
But you’re trying and learning and I love you for that not many modelers around here. Check some tutorials in Amy_webbs sig or Reyx7.
[/quote]ok thanks ill wait for vid and only first day. thanks for the advice[/quote]Yeah I traced a lot too, Most of my first 10+ models where all traced. But after learning how to use prims it goes easier and looks nicer.

Read full topic
item.source: Is this good for a first time model?
